results.title: 37 Stories about leaving home
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In 37 Stories About Leaving Home, a group of Japanese women living in the Tokyo area recount personal stories of their own experiences of leaving home. In these stories one can begin to see, from very personal and individual perspectives, the societal changes that have occurred over the last three generations for women in Japan, bringing an exciting and often conflicting array of choices and positions. Many of the stories revolve around the relationships these grandmothers, mothers and daughters have with each other, filled with respect, rebellion, loss and love. The interviews are framed by a traditional Japanese folktale, a magical and somewhat shocking narrative of a mother’s search for her abducted daughter, kidnapped by a monster on the eve of her wedding.

results.title: 36: Le Grand Tournant
results.creator_credit: Albina du Boisrouvray and Henri de Turenne
results.brief_description:
Through newsreel and archival footage this documentary evokes the great demonstrations on February 1934 in Paris and the rise of the ‘Front Populaire’ movement.

Credits: Producer, Albina du Boisrouvray ; director, Henri de Turenne ; writers, Jean Francois Revel, Pierre Hadrien ; music, Jean Pierre Bourtayre.
Cast: Serge Reggiani [narration].

results.title: 36 Fillette
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Emmanuel Schlumberger, Valerie Seydoux and Catherine Breillat
results.brief_description: The title refers to a child’s dress size, which the film’s heroine, Lili, has unmistakably outgrown. A sullen, uncommunicative 14 year old vacationing with her family in Biarritz, Lili is clearly ready to strike out on her own. She does so by dressing up in jeans, a corset and a raincoat, then hitching a ride to the local nightclub in search of adventure. Not surprisingly, adventure comes her way! “36 Fillette”, written and directed by French novelist Catherine Breillat, is based on one of her novels.

results.title: 34 years after Hitler
results.creator_credit: CBS News and William K McClure
results.brief_description: Looks at neo-Nazi groups in Germany today that have been known to destroy Jewish cemeteries, paint swastikas on the street and distribute anti-Semitic propaganda. While not viewed as a flourishing movement on the verge of popular acceptance, the neo-Nazis are shown to be a group whose philosophy and immediate predecessors demand that their activities be put into proper perspective.

results.title: 3:10 to Yuma = Three ten to Yuma
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, David Heilwell and Delmer Daves
results.brief_description: After a stage coach hold-up and killing, outlaw Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) is captured. Fearing a daring rescue by Wade’s gang who are too strong for the local lawmen to handle, a large bounty is offered to anyone willing to escort Wade by train to the state prison in Yuma. Hard hit by the crippling drought and attracted by the generous sum, rancher Dan Evans (Van Heflin) takes on the job. He collects Wade and begins the dangerous trek to the station.

results.title: 3 seconds from glory. [Part 2]
results.creator_credit: Spirit 2000 Productions, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and David Goldie
results.brief_description: Part two of a 2-part documentary about four young female Paralympians in the pursuit of excellence. Retraces footage from part one where the focus was perhaps a bit more on Christie and Holly to focusing on Angie and in particular, Louise, whose motivation and leadership enables the younger girls to be confident and mentally prepared for the big event. Two of them, Angie and Holly, had not even ventured overseas, let alone had the chance to experience the heat of international competition. But their lack of experience didn’t prevent these young Australian women from reaching for their dreams. Their immediate goal: win Australia’s first gold medal in the World Championship event. The second goal: break the world record. Presented and narrated by David Goldie.

results.title: 3 seconds from glory. [Part 1]
results.creator_credit: Spirit 2000 Productions, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and David Goldie
results.brief_description: Part one of a 2-part documentary about four young female Paralympians in the pursuit of excellence. At World Championship level, Australia had never won a women’s wheelchair relay event, nor been able to field a team at the time of making this documentary. But all this changed. Louise Sauvage (24 years old), Australia’s best wheelchair athlete and international medal winner, used her inspirational powers to gather a team together. This team consisted of Christie Skelton (18 years old), Angie Ballard (16 years old), Holly Ladmore (14 years old) and of course, Louise. David Goldie takes us into the lives of these four young women, two who were born with their handicap and two who became paraplegics through the tragic consequences of car accidents. His sensitive interviews with the girls and their families gives an insight to the focus and determination and the wonderful spirit in each of them, individually, and as a team. Louise, Holly, Christie and Angie are seen in training three weeks before the 1998 IPC Disability World Athletics Championship being held at Birmingham, England. Each has to compete in an individual event but it is the relay which unites and motivates them as a team. Introduced and narrated by David Goldie.
